ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.vector

Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.dag.Node
      • ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.AtomicFunction
        • ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.vector.Filter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connectable, Contextualizable, ExplanationQueryable, Function, Queryable, Duplicable

    public class Filter
extends AtomicFunction
    Filters the elements of a list based on the Boolean values of another.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.AtomicFunction

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> m_positions
      A list keeping track of the position in the input list of each element of the output list, the last time the function was called.

      • getValue

        protected java.lang.Object[] getValue(java.lang.Object... inputs)
                               throws InvalidNumberOfArgumentsException
        Description copied from class: AtomicFunction
        Computes the output value of the function based on input arguments.
        Specified by:
        getValue in class AtomicFunction
        Parameters:
        inputs - The input arguments.
        Returns:
        An array corresponding to the output values of the function. The size of this array is equal to the output arity of the function.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberOfArgumentsException - If the number of arguments of the method does not equal the input arity of the function

      • getExplanation

        public PartNode getExplanation(Part d,
                               NodeFactory factory)
        Description copied from interface: ExplanationQueryable
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part, using nodes provided by a given factory.
        Specified by:
        getExplanation in interface ExplanationQueryable
        Overrides:
        getExplanation in class AtomicFunction
        Parameters:
        d - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        factory - The factory that provides nodes
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.

      • appendExplanation

        protected void appendExplanation(LabelledNode root,
                                 int j,
                                 NodeFactory factory)
        Appends to a node the explanation for the i-th element of the output. In the case of the filter, the i-th output element is related to the j-th element of both input vectors, where j is the position of i in the input.
        Parameters:
        root - The node where children will be appended
        j - The position of the element in the input
        factory - The factory used to obtain node instances
